definition[0]: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns
example[0]: The Earth rotates on an axis between the north and south poles.
definition[1]: a line drawn across the middle of a regular shape that divides it into two equal parts
definition[2]: either of the two lines of a graph, by which the positions of points are measured
definition[3]: the countries, including Germany, Italy, and Japan, who fought together during World War II against the Allies.
